New Records: Jesús Luzardo (MIA) recorded his 10th win of the season.
Charlie Morton (ATL) allowed 6 runs but struck out 5 batters over 4.2 innings.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. (MIA) hit his 18th home run of the season in the 3rd inning.
Marcell Ozuna (ATL) hit his 35th home run of the season in the 8th inning.
Nick Fortes (MIA) hit his 6th home run of the season in the 8th inning.
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. (MIA) hit a 3rd-inning home run, driving in 4 runs with a solo shot to deep CF.
Marcell Ozuna (ATL) hit a 8th-inning home run, scoring 2 runs with a solo shot to deep LF.
Nick Fortes (MIA) hit a 8th-inning home run, scoring 1 run with a solo shot to deep LF.
The Braves scored 2 runs in the 8th inning, including a solo home run by Marcell Ozuna.
The Marlins scored 4 runs in the 3rd inning, highlighted by Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s home run.
Pre-Game Insights: Starting Lineups: Braves featured Ozzie Albies (2B), Austin Riley (3B), Matt Olson (1B), Marcell Ozuna (DH), and Charlie Morton (P). Marlins had Luis Arráez (2B), Jorge Soler (DH), Josh Bell (1B), Jazz Chisholm Jr. (CF), and Jesús Luzardo (P).
The game was played at loanDepot park with an attendance of 22,051 fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Atlanta Braves manager Brian Snitker expressed frustration with the team's performance after the loss.
The Marlins' victory was seen as a pivotal moment in their push towards the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played under clear skies with a temperature of 72°F and a slight breeze.
The Marlins' 16-2 victory marked their largest margin of victory in the season.
Others: The game took 2 hours and 54 minutes to complete.
The Braves had 36 base runners compared to the Marlins' 40.
